comments.body:
Looking at the docs, you missed a couple:
`axis, chart, isFirst and isLast.`
It doesn't say anywhere in the documentation that data can be null. Please revert.

From the documentation: https://api.highcharts.com/highcharts/series.line.data

> An array of numerical values. In this case, the numerical values will be interpreted as `y` options

> An array of arrays with 2 values. In this case, the values correspond to `x,y`.

edit for clarification: it is my understanding that "interpreted as `y` options" refers to the `y` option type that can be `number | null` found in this same pull request. In addition, I have tested all of these scenarios in my own code and they work as expected (null `y` values result in missing sections of line)

In addition the type annotation at https://github.com/highcharts/highcharts/blob/8f802d8c7/js/parts/Series.js#L5613 seems to allow it

> `* @type      {Array<number|Array<(number|string),(number|null)>|null|*>}`

Examples:

Data with number and null: https://jsfiddle.net/6vptua08/
Data with [number,number] and [number,null] pairs: https://jsfiddle.net/gzya3e7c/
Data with [string, number] and [string, null] (x value is inferred, in this case 1 per point): https://jsfiddle.net/gzya3e7c/2/
